column5: Having a disagreement on the interpretation of the rules. If you use a leadhead jig as the dropper weight on a three way rig, wouldn't that put you over your allowable hook count for your one line, making a three way set up this way illegal. Thanks for the input.

It depends on how many hooks are on the main bait. Many of us learned to fish as kids using the ole "Pickerel Rig" which was a multi bait set-up. A treble on a lure is considered one hook. A treble on its own is considered three hooks. ( Thats an odd old rule) You may have a total of FOUR hooks.
So a dropper jig and a floating jighead on a three way are legal...correct?
There is nothing I can see in the regs ( I am reading them now) that disallows it.
Pick up you fishing guide before you head out fishing just to be safe!
